unnormalised: ## Automotive News: Delhi Traffic Gets a Chai-Break Overhaul!
normalised: Folks in Delhi, buckle up! Major changes are brewing in the traffic regulations, announced just yesterday by Doctor Sharma, the Joint Commissioner. Remember that notorious U-turn near A I I M S? Gone! Replaced by a fancy new flyover (finally!).

unnormalised: Folks in Delhi, buckle up! Major changes are brewing in the traffic regulations, announced just yesterday by Dr. Sharma, the Joint Commissioner. Remember that notorious U-turn near AIIMS? Gone! Replaced by a fancy new flyover (finally!).
normalised: The crackdown on signal jumping is getting serious too. Expect hefty fines, maybe even rupees five thousand for repeat offenders. They're also planning to expand the no-parking zones, so watch out, especially around Connaught Place. Think twice before squeezing into that little gap; you might end up with a wheel clamp and a lighter wallet.

unnormalised: The crackdown on signal jumping is getting serious too. Expect hefty fines, maybe even Rs. 5000 for repeat offenders. They're also planning to expand the no-parking zones, so watch out, especially around Connaught Place. Think twice before squeezing into that little gap; you might end up with a wheel clamp and a lighter wallet.
normalised: Apparently, there’s also talk of implementing a “congestion tax” for entering certain areas during peak hours – haven’t heard the specifics yet, but expect it to sting! They’re also revamping the pedestrian crossings, aiming for safer walkways spanning five hundred square feet at key junctions. Let's hope these changes actually ease the chaos and we can all get home in time for our evening chai!
